reviews.review_msg: Made an account to write a review about this guy...very nice but HORRIBLE at teaching physics. He completely ruined my experience with physics courses. Throughout the whole course he did not give ONE written example!!! How are we supposed to learn physics (or any quantitative science) without worked, written problems?

this prof is one of the worst profs i've ever had. his lectures are boring and mainly consist of iclicker questions. i studied SO much for midterms only to get 30% on both. they are nothing like the practice exams he puts out or the examples he gives in class. the final was even harder and very different from everything he "taught" us

The midterms and final were nothing like any of the practice exams or any of the homework, I do not see the point in making exams so hard that you almost can't even bs the questions just to curve the class at the end anyway. It totally stifles learning. Kero, I hope you learn how to run a class bc you seem nice enough but this was not it.

I studied day n night just to get 20% on both mid 1 and 2. The exam questions were nowhere close to the sample questions. Also I am getting kicked out of engineering for this dude. He is awful human with a very thick accent.

Kero is such bad prof. He only reads off of lecture slides, the lecture slides don't make sense and he expects everyone to know 100% of the material. He gives out too much homework and his test are impossible to solve. Don't go to his office hours because you will only leave with disappoint because when I went he basically told me to go F%$# myself

Phys 121 is just straight awful. Even if its curved midterm average for an entry level circuit course should not be a 40%. He grades to really specific answers that if you don't get it's a 0. The questions on both assignments and tests are so poorly written and complex. And the lectures are just iclicker questions, no teaching.
Oh em gee this is simply not it if I do say so myself. He does seem like a nice guy but after the midterm he is the enemy.
F U and everything u stand for. You've made my semester so much harder than it had to be. I was happy until I stepped foot into your lecture hall.
